events.title: Lusitania Sinking
events.description: The British ocean liner RMS Lusitania was sunk by a German U-boat off the coast of Ireland during World War I, resulting in the deaths of 1,198 passengers and crew.
events.significance: The sinking increased anti-German sentiment and contributed to the United States' eventual decision to enter World War I.

events.title: Space Shuttle Challenger Disaster
events.description: The NASA Space Shuttle Challenger broke apart 73 seconds after launch, killing all seven astronauts on board, including Christa McAuliffe, the first teacher selected to fly in space.
events.significance: The disaster led to a reevaluation of the space program's safety protocols and a 32-month hiatus in the shuttle program.

events.title: Construction of the Golden Gate Bridge Begins
events.description: Work commenced on the Golden Gate Bridge in San Francisco, which would become one of the most iconic suspension bridges in the world.
events.significance: The bridge became an important transportation link and an engineering marvel that symbolized innovation and progress.

events.title: Jane Austen's 'Pride and Prejudice' Published
events.description: Jane Austen's novel 'Pride and Prejudice' was published for the first time in the United Kingdom.
events.significance: The novel became one of the most popular and enduring works of English literature, influencing countless adaptations and studies.
